perturbation.original_text:
16.  CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND PRESS:



 (a) Confidential: Each party agrees to use reasonable efforts, and at least the same care that it uses to protect its own confidential information of like importance, to prevent unauthorized dissemination and disclosure of the other party’s confidential information
perturbation.changed_text:
16.  CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND PRESS:



 (a) Confidential: Each party may, at their discretion, disclose confidential information. There is no obligation to prevent unauthorized dissemination and disclosure of the other party’s confidential information
perturbation.explanation: The original text obligates parties to protect each other’s confidential information.  The modified version removes this obligation and grants parties the discretion to disclose confidential information, directly contradicting the initial agreement to protect it.

perturbation.original_text: For the Term of this Agreement, Fox hereby grants to Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A) in which (i) Fox owns or controls licensing and merchandising rights, for which Fox determines in its sole discretion to grant to any third party any licensing rights for the development and distribution of wireless products, and (ii) which theatrical motion pictures Fox reasonably deems to be a Major Release consistent with its past practices.
perturbation.changed_text: Fox may or may not grant to Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A) in which (i) Fox owns or controls licensing and merchandising rights, for which Fox determines in its sole discretion to grant to any third party any licensing rights for the development and distribution of wireless products, and (ii) which theatrical motion pictures Fox reasonably deems to be a Major Release consistent with its past practices.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures, While the modified version removes the certainty by introducing “may or may not grant”, making it unclear when the Right of First Negotiation applies.

perturbation.original_text: (d) No Preferential Treatment:  Licensee agrees that it will use substantially similar efforts to advertise, promote, manufacture, sell and distribute the Wireless Products as it devotes to its other licensed products.
perturbation.changed_text: (d) No Preferential Treatment:  Licensee agrees that it will devote any resources it deems fit to advertise, promote, manufacture, sell and distribute the Wireless Products as it devotes to its other licensed products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text obligates Licensee to use substantially similar efforts to advertise, promote, manufacture, sell and distribute the Wireless Products as it devotes to its other licensed products.  The modified version removes this obligation, directly contradicting the initial agreement to use substantially similar effort.
